description: From a series of five lithographs for Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse) by Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919; figure dressed in black with closed eyes in center of image being lifted under the armpits by a figure behind him; in the background is a crowd of wide-eyed figures looking at lifeless figure in the foreground
inscription: LLC in plate in reverse: P.W.G. / 19. | LL in pencil, below image: 5) | LL of sheet, in pencil: Privat-exemplar. | LR of sheet, in pencil: \"Wie wohl ist mir\" | LLC of sheet in pencil, on verso: 2397
portfolio: From Plate 5 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse), Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919
signed: LR in pencil, below image: Walter Gramatté / 19
title: Fedja Dies, Plate 5 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse)
